subprocess_flow.description: The Regulatory Submission Preparation sub-step involves gathering, organizing, and formatting all necessary documentation and data required for submission to regulatory agencies. This includes clinical trial data, manufacturing information, pre-clinical study reports, and any other relevant information. The goal is to ensure that the submission is complete, accurate, and compliant with all applicable regulatory guidelines and requirements, facilitating a smooth and efficient review process.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To compile all necessary information for regulatory review.
subprocess_flow.scope: Preparation of the initial regulatory submission package.
end_conditions: Draft regulatory submission is complete and ready for review
governance_requirements: Compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., FDA, EMA)

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to the submission preparation process are managed through a formal change control process, ensuring that all changes are documented, reviewed, and approved before implementation.

subprocess_flow.description: The Internal Review sub-step involves a thorough review of the draft regulatory submission by internal stakeholders, including medical, scientific, and regulatory experts. This review ensures that the submission is scientifically sound, medically accurate, and compliant with all applicable regulatory requirements. The goal is to identify and address any potential issues or gaps in the submission before it is formally submitted to regulatory agencies.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To ensure the quality and accuracy of the submission.
subprocess_flow.scope: Internal review and approval of the regulatory submission.
governance_requirements: Compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., FDA, EMA)

change_management.change_request_process: Changes identified during the internal review are managed through a formal change control process, ensuring that all changes are documented, reviewed, and approved before implementation.

improvement_inputs: Root cause analysis of identified issues

subprocess_flow.description: The Agency Submission sub-step involves the formal submission of the regulatory filing to the appropriate regulatory agency (e.g., FDA, EMA). This includes submitting the required documentation and data in the specified format and through the designated submission portal. The goal is to ensure that the submission is received and accepted by the regulatory agency, initiating the review process.
success_criteria: Submission is successfully received by the regulatory agency
subprocess_flow.purpose: To formally submit the application to the regulatory agency.
subprocess_flow.scope: Submission of the regulatory filing to the agency.
end_conditions: Submission confirmation is received from the regulatory agency

step_risks_and_controls.control: Validation of submission format and content.
Backup submission methods and technical support.

governance_requirements: Compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., FDA, EMA)

change_management.change_request_process: Any changes required after submission are managed through a formal amendment process, ensuring that all changes are documented, reviewed, and approved before implementation.

subprocess_flow.description: The Agency Interaction sub-step involves ongoing communication and interaction with the regulatory agency during the review process. This includes responding to requests for additional information, clarifying any questions or concerns, and participating in meetings or teleconferences with agency reviewers. The goal is to facilitate a timely and positive review outcome by providing the agency with all necessary information and addressing any issues that may arise.
success_criteria: Timely and accurate responses to agency requests
Positive and productive interactions with agency reviewers
subprocess_flow.purpose: To address agency questions and facilitate the review process.
subprocess_flow.scope: Communication and interaction with the regulatory agency.
triggers: Receipt of agency requests for information

step_risks_and_controls.control: Dedicated regulatory affairs team and tracking system.
Clear and concise communication with agency reviewers.

governance_requirements: Compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., FDA, EMA)

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to the submission based on agency feedback are managed through a formal amendment process, ensuring that all changes are documented, reviewed, and approved before implementation.

improvement_inputs: Analysis of agency requests and responses

subprocess_flow.description: The Approval and Post-Approval sub-step involves receiving the regulatory approval letter from the agency and ensuring compliance with any post-approval requirements. This includes implementing any required post-market surveillance studies, submitting periodic safety reports, and complying with any other conditions of approval. The goal is to ensure that the drug product remains safe and effective throughout its lifecycle and that all regulatory requirements are met.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To obtain final approval and maintain compliance.

step_risks_and_controls.control: Dedicated regulatory affairs team and tracking system.
Post-market surveillance and adverse event reporting.

governance_requirements: Compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., FDA, EMA)

change_management.change_request_process: Changes to post-approval activities are managed through a formal change control process, ensuring that all changes are documented, reviewed, and approved before implementation.
